intro: Lachenalia mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces tall, branched stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, tubular flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in succulent gardens.
